labels.analysis: The MCP Sentry Server is designed to interact with Sentry, a popular error tracking and performance monitoring tool. It allows users to fetch and manage issue and event details seamlessly, leveraging Sentry's API to enhance debugging workflows. The available tools enable users to list organization projects, list and filter project issues, and retrieve detailed event information. This server primarily serves as a bridge between users and Sentry's functionality, streamlining access to error tracking and debugging data.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is chosen as "Debugging & Error Tracking" because the server's core functionality revolves around accessing and managing Sentry issues and events, which are central to debugging processes. The secondary label "API Integration" is selected because the server acts as an intermediary, standardized interface to Sentry's API. "Database Operations" is also relevant due to the server's ability to query and manage issue data, though it is a secondary functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Sentry Server
server_info_crawled.author: @zereight/sentry-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Fetch and manage Sentry issue and event details seamlessly. Integrate with your Sentry projects to retrieve insights and streamline your debugging process. Enhance your workflow by leveraging Sentry's powerful API through a standardized interface.

tools.name: get_sentry_issue
tools.description: Deploy Server Sentry Server @zereight/sentry-mcp Try in Playground get_sentry_issue

tools.name: list_organization_projects
tools.description: List all projects for the configured Sentry organization

tools.name: list_project_issues
tools.description: List issues for a specific project, with optional filtering.

tools.name: get_event_details
tools.description: Get details for a specific event within a project.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@zereight/sentry-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
